comments:
(1)create a project with the following class in two separate workspaces

   public class Bicycle {

   }

(2) switch to one workspace and extract an interface called 'IDriveable'
(3) create a script from the refactoring and switch to the other (unmodified)
    workspace
(4) applying the refactoring script fails (gracefully) telling you that the 
    input does not exsist.

This must have something to do with the fact that the extracted interface is empty. If Bicycle has a method (e.g. drive) which is extracted into the interface things work fine.

If you try this with 'extract superclass' (same class as above, but extracting abstract -empty- class ADriveable), apply script will fail and you'll find the following message in your error log:
